text: Which of the following quantities has the same unit as the watt?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Actual thickness = 34 - 22 = 12 

error thickness = 30 - 20 = 10 

error = 12 - 10 = 2mm that is, (11 ± 1)mm

%error = \(\frac{1}{11}\) x \(\frac{100}{1}\)

= 9%

text: The external and internal diameter of a tube are measured as (32 ± 2)mm and (21 ± 1)mm respectively. Determine the percentage error in the thickness of the tube.
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
\(\theta\) = tan-1\(\frac{3}{7}\)

text: Two forces of magnitudes 7N and 3N act at right angles to each other. The angle \(\theta\) between the resultant and the 7N force is given by
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Thrust = \(\frac{\text{mass x velocity}}{time}\) 

= 10 x 5 x 103


= 5.0 x 104N

text: A rocket burns fuel at the rate of 10kgs-1 and ejects it with velocity of 5 x 103ms-1. The thrust exerted by the gas on the rock is
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Intensity = \(\frac{1.002 \times 102}{60}\)

= 1.67Nkg-1

text: The force experienced by an object of mass 60.0kg in the moon's gravitational field is 1.002 x 102N. What is the intensity of the gravitational field?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text: Explanation

text: Which of the following correctly describes the energy changes in the generation of light by a hydroelectric power station?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
V.R = \(\frac{1}{sin\theta}\) 

= 10

sin = \(\frac{1}{10}\)

text: A plane inclined at angle \(\theta\) has a velocity ratio of 10 : 1. The inclination of the plane to the horizontal is given by
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
P = 2 x 1000 x 10 

= 2 x 104NM-2

text: A weightless vessel of dimensions 4m x 3m x 2m is filled with a liquid of density 1000kgm-3 and sealed. What is the maximum pressure this container can exert on a flat surface? [g = 10ms-2]
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
volume of object = \(\frac{400 \times 10^{-2}}{600}\)

= 0.00067m3

volume of paraffin displaced = \(\frac{1}{2}\) x 0.00067 

= 0.00034m3

mass of paraffin = 900 x 34 x 10-5

= 0.3kg

weight of paraffin = 0.3 x 10

= 3N = upthrust = tension in the string

subject: PHYSICS

subject: PHYSICS

text: A metal rod 800mm long is heated from 10oC to 95oC. If it expands by 1.36mm, the linear expansivity of the metal is
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
\(\frac{P_1V_1}{T_1}\) = \(\frac{P_2V_2}{T_2}\)

V1 = 2V2 and T2 = 2T1

\(\frac{P_1\times 2V_2}{T_1}\) = \(\frac{P_2\times V_2}{2T_1}\)


P2 = 4P1

text: When the volume of a given mass of gas is halved and its temperature doubled, the pressure
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Heat lost = heat gained

200 x c x (90 - \(\theta\))= 100\(\times\) c \(\times\) (\(\theta - 30\))
Dividing through by 100c, we have
2(\(90 - \theta\)) = (\(\theta - 30\))
simplifying, we have
\(\theta\) = 70°

text: 200g of water at 90°C is mixed with 100g of water at 30°C. What is the final temperature?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
L = - \(\lambda\) \(\Rightarrow\)4L = 3 \(\lambda\)

text: The relationship between L and the wavelength I of the stationary wave is
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Distance XX = \(\frac{1}{2}\)\(\lambda\)

= \(\frac{1}{2}\) x \(\frac{60}{1}\)

= 30cm

text: Determine the distance between the consecutive antinodes XX if the wavelength is 60cm
subject: PHYSICS

text: Which of the following waves can propagate through a vacuum?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Time = 1 x 4 x 10-3sec 

distance = velocity x time 

= 3 x 108 x 4 x 10-3

= 6 x 105m

text: Radio waves emitted from an antenna are picked up by a radar after reflection from an aircraft in 4 x 10-3S. How far is the aircraft from the antenna? [c = 3 x 108ms-1 ]
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
F = \(\frac{r}{2}\) and v = mu

F = \(\frac{UV}{U + V}\)

\(\frac{r}{2}\) = \(\frac{U \times mu}{U + mu}\)

\(\frac{r}{2}\) = \(\frac{mu^2}{u(1 + m)}\)

\(\frac{r}{2} = \frac{mu}{1+m}\)
\(\frac{r}{2} = \frac{v}{1+m}\)
\(\frac{2v}{r} = 1+m\)
\(m = \frac{2v}{r} - 1\)

text: Which of the following expressions gives the linear magnification produced by a concave mirror of radius of curvature r, if U and V are the object and image distances respectively?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
F = \(\frac{uv}{u + v}\)

20 = \(\frac{100 \times v}{100 + v}\)

v = 25cm

subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:

text: Which of the following may be used to explain a mirage? i. layers of air near the road surface have varying refractive indices in hot weather. ii. road surfaces sometimes become good reflectors in hot weathers. iii. light from the sky can be reflected upwards after coming close to the road surface.
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
\(\frac{4}{3}\) = \(\frac{sin30}{sinr}\)

r = 22oC

text: A beam of light is incident from air to water at an angle of 30oC. Find the angle of refraction if the refractive index of water is \(\frac{4}{3}\)
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
The ciliary body produces the fluid in the eye called aqueous humor.
It also contains the ciliary muscle, which changes the shape of the lens when your eyes focus on a near object.
This process is called accommodation.

text: The terminal voltage of a battery is 4.0V when supplying a current of 2.0A, and 2.0V when supplying a current of 3.0A. The internal resistance of the battery is
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
Q = it 

= 100 x 10-3 x 2 x 60

= 12C

text: A current of 100mA passes through a conductor for 2 minutes. The quantity of electricity transported is
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
C = \(\frac {\varepsilon_o\ A}{d}\)

10-2 x 10-6 = \(\frac {9 \times 10 ^{-12}}{d}\) x 10-4

= 9 x 10-7m

text: A parallel plate capacitor of area 10cm2 in vacuum has a capacitance of 10-2\(\mu\)F. What is the distance between the plates?(e = 9 x 10-12fm)
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
P = \(\frac{V}{R}\) 

V = \(\sqrt{PR}\)

V = \(\sqrt{40 \times 90}\)

= 60V

text: A 40-W instrument has a resistance of 90\(\Omega\). On what voltage should it be operated normally?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
An induction coil is a transformer for producing high-voltage alternating current from a low-voltage direct current, consisting essentially of two concentric coils with a common soft-iron core, a primary coil with relatively few windings of heavy wire, and a secondary coil with many turns of fine wire. Excitation of the primary coil by rapidly interrupted or variable current induces high voltage in the secondary coil.

text: The primary aim in high tension transmission is to

options.text: minimize electrical energy losses due to heat production
increase the rate of energy transfer by using high voltage
increase the current in the wire
generate electricity at high current and low voltage

subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
XL = 2\(\pi\)FL

= 2 x 3.142 x 30 x 10-3 x 1.3 x 103

= 245\(\Omega\)

options.text: time duration of the incident radiation

explanation.text:
Explanation
Total Distance covered is the Area of the Trapezium
Area of the Trapezium = \(\frac{1}{2}\) X ( sum of parallel sides ) X height
=  \(\frac{1}{2}\) X ( 30 + 45 ) X 10
: S = 375m

= 6 x 105m

text: Radio waves emitted from an antenna are picked up by a radar after reflection from an aircraft in 4 x 10-3S. How far is the aircraft from the antenna? [c = 3 x 108ms-1 ]
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
F = \(\frac{r}{2}\) and v = mu

F = \(\frac{UV}{U + V}\)

\(\frac{r}{2}\) = \(\frac{U \times mu}{U + mu}\)

\(\frac{r}{2}\) = \(\frac{mu^2}{u(1 + m)}\)

\(\frac{r}{2} = \frac{mu}{1+m}\)
\(\frac{r}{2} = \frac{v}{1+m}\)
\(\frac{2v}{r} = 1+m\)
\(m = \frac{2v}{r} - 1\)

subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
F = \(\frac{uv}{u + v}\)

20 = \(\frac{100 \times v}{100 + v}\)

v = 25cm

explanation.text:
Explanation
The ciliary body produces the fluid in the eye called aqueous humor.
It also contains the ciliary muscle, which changes the shape of the lens when your eyes focus on a near object.
This process is called accommodation.

P = \(\frac{V}{R}\) 

V = \(\sqrt{PR}\)

V = \(\sqrt{40 \times 90}\)

= 60V

text: A 40-W instrument has a resistance of 90\(\Omega\). On what voltage should it be operated normally?
subject: PHYSICS

explanation.text:
Explanation
An induction coil is a transformer for producing high-voltage alternating current from a low-voltage direct current, consisting essentially of two concentric coils with a common soft-iron core, a primary coil with relatively few windings of heavy wire, and a secondary coil with many turns of fine wire. Excitation of the primary coil by rapidly interrupted or variable current induces high voltage in the secondary coil.
